title: This is a Creative Works Forum
body:
This section of the forum is for creative works so please do not downvote others it is rude, disrespectful, and uncalled for so just do not do it. Concepts and Creations we do not want discourage creativity here and downvoting discourages people give their creative ideas which a lot are super cool, but if you discourage this process then people are less likely to share cool things because people do not like being shat on.

Riot should help out and disable downvoting for Concepts and Creations. Posts that do not belong here will just be reported and Riot will deal with them, but all posts that do belong here do not belong to be downvoted as most work here people put in a lot of care and time into what they created so others should be considerate here.

****

If you want to encourage cool art work and champion concepts for Concepts and Creations if you ever see art or champion concepts below +1 then upvote it, even if you did not see or read the post, to counter-act the assholes and trolls because I really want League of Legends to have a good community and we need to put in some kind of effort to do that because I am getting sick of the toxicity that has risen over the year. Back in season 1 League of Legends had the number one best gaming community to be in and we can get back to this if we tried and change the mindset of "League of Legends community is toxic". We can start by showing kindness to others and encourage creative works, even if it is not perfect or very good, we can give nice feedback that actually helps them improve in a good fashion and then suddenly we will a super awesome community that people want to be around and every benefits with having super good and cool creative work in this specific forum. BUT we **have** to work together in order to accomplish this because being a community is a team effort to help each other out.

****

Thank-you for your time!
~ Stacona

They even posted on my own fanart, but they rarely to never post on champion concepts and I can understand why because they want champion concepts to be a fun creative process of making a champion rather than "making a champion concept with the intention of an ability or two being on the next upcoming champion". I just know the champion team does read this forum, mainly for inspiration on new fresh ideas for future champions, which I find is super cool even if they act like stealth ninjas about it.

If I'm gonna be terribly honest, I have tons of skin and champion ideas on my computer but I feel like there's no point in even posting them here. I've seen a lot of really good concepts but they have maybe 1 upvote and no comments at all, even several days after. It seems like the only way to get any feedback at all is to either create a meme-y joke champion or to repost something (preferably sexy) you found on deviantart. If you're really lucky you might get the elusive Red post, which guarantees you'll get hundreds of upvotes and comments.
And yeah, I browsed by "most recent" and like everyone is at 0 or -1 with no comments. There's some quality posts there too! If you disagree with something in the post, say it! The creative boards is for feedback, not mindless downvoting.

There's a couple of approaches to this that all have their own issues.
First, I personally think downvoting **shouldn't** be removed. Now before you call me a "downvoting troll", if you check my post history I make a strong effort to give full feedback on ideas I take interest in, even those I think don't work that great.

While downvoting does enable trolls to an extent, some ideas are just plain bad or inflammatory. In this situation, a downvote is needed because you should not support that idea. Now, this makes the issue of downvoting without feedback, so here's another scenario.
Let's say rather than remove downvotes altogether, you had to make a comment on the thread before you downvoted it. It removes anonymity and potentially provides feedback. But here's other issue: What if the user can't take feedback? What if, despite multiple people telling them their idea doesn't seem good, the poster responds with harassment? It can result in arguments that wouldn't have happened if the user had just been allowed to downvote anonymously.

But let's say you **do** know who is downvoting your work. What can you do? You can't force someone to change that opinion. Whether they gave it because they genuinely don't agree or they gave it because they're trolling, that's their prerogative. There are just people like that in the world. That said, not every idea is great. Not every concept submitted by a person is good.

Anyway that's just me. I always think there should be a spot reserved for criticism, whether it be known or unknown. A character design teacher of 20 years summed it up perfectly once: "If you disallow criticism then your idea swims in mediocrity". If there are no 'bad' ideas, then you can't weed them out from the 'good' ones.

Now: everything said and done, I can unfortunately tell you this now that downvotes won't be removed. It is the nature of the forums that Riot have built, and even allow themselves to be downvoted. Just learn to move passed it.

If you are nice about it people are accepting of feedback and if you are not being nice then people take it as bashing on them. You will provide feedback to help them improve, but downvoting does not do that it is lazy and for trolls, it tells the poster absolutely nothing and once you downvote it puts someone is bad mood and then they do not accept any feedback.

It doesn't make if things are great or good, but we do not want to discourage the creative process just because someone does not know how to polish their ideas does not mean their ideas are bad and they can have good points and just need improvements. We don't want to discourage creativity because that would mean we get less and less fresh and new ideas. So what downvoting does is make everyone eventually think the same because if they think differently they just shit by trolls downvoting and people change their opinions if they see negativity rather than positivity so no one will ever give a downvoted post a fair shake.

It's not for trolls. If I see a thread that says "Make Ballet Sion" and the only line in the thread is "It would be so funny! I would pay so much money!", I can downvote that. If the user hasn't bothered to put in the effort to describe their idea or why it should be a part of the game, why should I have to put in the effort to make a comment? And I've been downvoted plenty of times before. It doesn't put me in a bad mood in the slightest. If you let it affect your mood that's when it becomes an issue. You've bought up a few times the fact that someone has been following you around downvoting your stuff. Did you ever stop to think that maybe it's because you're making so many comments about how your stuff is being downvoted? Sure, it's clearly someone trying to poke you, but at the same time what do you honestly expect to happen? It's like people who touch stuff that has a 'Caution: Wet Paint' sign. If you ask people not to, there's always going to be people who will.

> It doesn't make if things are great or good, but we do not want to discourage the creative process just because someone does not know how to polish their ideas does not mean their ideas are bad and they can have good points and just need improvements. We don't want to discourage creativity because that would mean we get less and less fresh and new ideas.

It's not about discouraging creativity. A downvote represents a disagreement or a dislike of the people that are on the forums at the time. You could submit an idea at 9AM and the same idea at 9PM and they would get different results. Heck, within the last day [someone has proven just that
](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/PVNBqfox-update-the-inhibitors-icon). That was his **third time** submitting the same thread. The first time got 3 upvotes and the second time got a -1. But he stuck with his idea. He saw that he posted it during a time where he maybe wouldn't have gotten a lot of exposure, and tried again. Now, I am not encouraging people to spam the forums with their ideas. I'm just saying that there are more factors than you may think there are.

>So what downvoting does is make everyone eventually think the same because if they think differently they just shit by trolls downvoting and people change their opinions if they see negativity rather than positivity so no one will ever give a downvoted post a fair shake.

 I used to frequent these forums quite a bit. I myself am an artist who strives to work in the game industry soon. I used to use these boards as a way to practice my craft before I worked to make a professional portfolio. My work consisted of a couple of custom champs that featured some doodles or artwork I did on my spare time. Among the many people who gave constructive feedback, I also received more flack that I could have anticipated - mostly from people who took a glance at my work w/o looking into it. This was mostly done in the format of anonymous downvotes without any rhyme or reason. In their eyes, it's easy to drop in and dislike something for the sake of disliking it - because it removes all responsibility.

Maybe, the answer to this dilemma is to make any dislike on a thread prompt a comment to justify a negative vote. In order for the negative review to stick, it could be reviewed by a forum moderator for depth or for validity before going into effect. Maybe a large volume of justified, negative votes could get a post removed if it is offensive, or plagiarized, etc.

I know for a fact that a piece of my work had a lot of negative votes than lacked any kind of constructive critique comments to back them up. Maybe I wouldn't be so PO'd if I could at least have a chance to make my piece petter in some people's eyes, or at least fix what they think might be wrong (if there is anything in particular). Just some fodder for thought.

I know how bad it sounds, but what if you don't like their art? I mean, all's fair in criticism as long as you give a reason. I mean, I'm going to sound like an asshole here, but should we not feel free to express our opinions as an audience just because someone somewhere might find it off-putting?

No, you don't need to be a dick to someone ever. If you don't like something then you don't like something, it does mean you have to like, but it also does not mean someone else will not like it. You can give constructive criticism that helps them improve because that is what comments are for, but we do not need downvoting because downvoting does not help them improve it just makes them never want to draw ever again and never improve because they never draw anymore because shat on them.

There is opinions and there is realizing people have feelings and you need to be sensitive to that as well. So even you agree with your comment downvoting should be removed so the forum can become a forum where people talk about the main topic of the post and discuss things and help people improve and get better, because you can do constructive criticism in a nice way, because dickish criticism is just ignored even if it has a constructive element in it; but downvoting helps no one and just places people in a bad mood which is what helps create toxicity.

Downvoting is a butterfly effect, bring down a number may seem harmless but all you know what you just did prevented that person from ever sharing their thoughts and that same person could be the one that finds a permanent cure for cancer in the form of a chewable pill. This might sound over dramatic to you as an example, but it really is not because this is how the butterfly effect works, it chain reacts off the smallest of things and changes a huge thing in the future for better or worse depending on what that small little action was; and it can be 20 years down the line but that one downvote stopped cancer from being cured for good and that was the only person that knew how to cure cancer but he shared his ideas one time for a game, got shat on, and never shared his ideas ever again because he was afraid of people shitting on him and his ideas.

You're making a lot of assumptions. We're both on high alert here, probably for different reasons. You see a lot of toxicity and harsher than necessary criticism, I see people all around me trying to speech-police people, because of "Feelings." Got something to say? Better be careful, if someone somewhere disagrees with your message, you can get reprimanded for it. I see college campuses doing shit like this and it makes me sick.

But what I was saying comes from a genuine feeling that downvotes are ok. If they hurt you that much you have some insecurities. However, comments like "You suck" or "Go drink bleach because you're so bad" are another thing. These are not acceptable. When I say criticism, I mean pointing out specific things that could have been done better. Without comments like these, you never improve. Well, you do, but they  can be helpful.

The thing is I want  feedback, downvotes do absolutely nothing but piss people off and give trolls power. Again, downvoting is forever going to be a bad system I rather have people speaking their mind on the subject matter than do a -1 because that negative says absolutely nothing and will never improve the main post. 

-1 is just dick shitter troll downvoting because he thinks it is fun to shit on people. Where as a thought out comment actually provides feedback of some kind for the original idea can be improved on and made better; if not thought out than it is problem harassment then the person gets reported and banned. Either way both scenarios help make the forums a better place and make the community more interactive with each other, and downvoting both lazy and just pisses people off. 

****

Also yes and no it is a lot of assumptions because downvoting someone is an action you did that affects another which again is what the butterfly effect is. The butterfly effect is doing something that seems so small you think it has no impact on someone but in the gran scheme of things that negative action could have made someone instead of curing cancer permanently and creating the ultimate energy source he instead becomes a super villain, genocides 3 billion people, and enslaves the other 4 billion. I don't care if an example is absurd the point still stands that the tiniest of actions can create giant tsunami of consequences later on and that is something this community does not understand is someone else's point of view and long term aspects.

****

At least forcing people to comment more makes things no longer hidden and anonymous so if people want to be assholes to people and trolls then they can be reported and banned rather than nothing happening; plus it will lead to more feedback to improve on ideas (useful feedback not, "omg super op broken you suck" something like that should get you banned).

One of the other problems of disabling ratings in any way on the boards is that it's so integrated into the board. Only being able to upvote means it will be more likely to get exposure on the front page. Take away ratings entirely, and art threads have less of a chance of being featured on the front page, unless we remove ratings board-wide, and that's just looking at it objectively.
